title: Petersburg student accidentally shoots himself on school bus
content:
PETERSBURG, Va (WRIC) — A Petersburg High School spokesperson has confirmed to 8News that there was a gun incident on a school bus on Monday.
A school official says that the student had a concealed weapon on the bus and accidentally shot himself in the leg.
“Around 12:30 p.m. on Monday, March 16, 2015, a Petersburg High School student — who was riding bus number 61 — had a concealed weapon,” officials said in a press release about the incident. “During the transport, the weapon discharged — striking the student in question.”
The bus driver immediately investigated what sounded like a “small firecracker.” Officials say the source of the noise wasn’t clear right away.
Upon further investigation, Petersburg City Public Schools along with the Petersburg Police Department later determined that a Petersburg High student shot himself in the leg while on the bus.
“We are vigorously reviewing this incident, as well as policy and procedures. Meanwhile, PCPS is stepping up its safety measures by increasing random student searches.”
The investigation into the matter is ongoing, school officials say.
Stay with 8News for updates.
